{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3400280,"name":"","username":"walnut2018","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/71c47a/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-06-19T22:47:58.772Z","cooked":"

Hello! I’m trying to CAD swerve drivetrain. From an engineering perspective, is it correct that I have two left-hand and two-right hand modules? Does it matter which corner the modules go on? Also, what does it mean if a module is left vs right hand.
Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-06-19T22:47:58.772Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":243,"readers_count":242,"score":88.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":467790,"topic_slug":"swerve-drivetrain-cad","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66980,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swerve-drivetrain-cad/467790/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3400281,"name":"Aiden L","username":"Baby_Carrot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/baby_carrot/{size}/203814_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-19T22:52:46.601Z","cooked":"

From my experience with MAXSwerve, left and right hand refer to the wire placement (and associated SPARKMax mount). You can use any combo of left and right hand, but 2102 usually uses two of each to simplify the wiring.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-06-19T22:52:46.601Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":245,"readers_count":244,"score":54.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":467790,"topic_slug":"swerve-drivetrain-cad","display_username":"Aiden L","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53542,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Trade shirts with me!"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drivetrain-cad/467790/2","custom_user_title":"Trade shirts with me!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400282,"name":"Ian Saam","username":"Enjsnake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/enjsnake/{size}/201559_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-19T22:57:48.590Z","cooked":"

Most modules don’t have 2 different “left” and “right” variants since they are symmetric, some small differences in wiring may occur due to drive vs steer motors being in different places. The only module to truly have a left and right is the SDS MK4n, since the goal of that module is to open up as much space on the front of your drivetrain as possible, and are not symmetric.

walnut2018:

right

If I have two left hand and two right hand swerve modules, should the two left hand go on the left side of the drivetrain?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-06-19T23:16:24.698Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":208,"readers_count":207,"score":46.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":467790,"topic_slug":"swerve-drivetrain-cad","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66980,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swerve-drivetrain-cad/467790/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400368,"name":"","username":"Ugydukin","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/u/278dde/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-06-20T04:03:00.392Z","cooked":"

Doesn’t matter, although if you look at the modules once you have placed them, put the “left” and “right” hand modules in whichever orientation looks most symmetric/fits well with your drive base.

Did you mirror the modules to the opposite corners? Most modules only have on variant unless you mirror it in CAD.
